oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Lockett, Samuel H. (Samuel Henry), 1837-1891; Vicksburg (Miss.) - History - Siege, 1863
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half-length portrait of Samuel Henry Lockett in Confederate uniform. He wears the insigna of a lieutenant colonel.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Washburn
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samuel Henry Lockett was a Confederate engineer responsible for the defenses of Vicksburg. He later taught mathematics and science at Louisiana State University and the University of Tennessee at Knoxville. He also served as an engineer in the Egyptian Army and was involved with the construction of the Statue of Liberty.
